meanings.definition: Capable of being mitigated or lessened.
meanings.sent1: The teacher found the student's mistake to be mitigable with a little extra help.
meanings.sent2: The doctor assured the patient that the pain was mitigable with medication.
meanings.sent3: The chef discovered that the bland soup was mitigable with a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds made the sunny day seem less mitigable.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet was a constant reminder of the mitigable water waste.
